newsitem.title: FRANCE: French consumer prices rise 0.3 percent in January.
newsitem.headline: French consumer prices rise 0.3 percent in January.

text.p: French consumer prices rose 0.3 percent in January from December, giving a year-on-year rise of 1.8 percent, national statistics office INSEE said on Tuesday.
INSEE said that after seasonal adjustment, the monthly rise in consumer prices was 0.1 percent.

The monthly increase included a 1.6 percent rise in the price of food, due mostly to a 9.7 percent rise in the price of fresh produce, hit by exceptionally cold weather at the beginning of the month, INSEE said.
There was also a 1.1 percent drop in the price of manufactured goods, due to winter sales and a change in calculation methods to take account of European price index harmonisation.
Public tariffs rose 1.4 percent, partly reflecting a 4.9 percent rise in tobacco prices made on December 20.
The government is forecasting a year-on-year rise in consumer prices of 1.5 percent this year.
